New Records: Nick Castellanos reached the 20-home run plateau in a season for the sixth time in his career
Key Match Events: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line
Nick Castellanos homered and scored from third on Wilson's hit
Castellanos was hit by pitches twice in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Schwarber was scratched after feeling discomfort in his left elbow during batting practice
Schwarber was removed from the game on Tuesday after hyperextending the elbow while diving into first base
Post-Match Reflections: Castellanos gave credit to Cash for apologizing for the incident the night before
Wilson praised the Phillies' organization for trusting players to come up in big situations
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine
The Rays asked home plate umpire John Bacon if the ball hit Wilson on the way down the line, but Bacon said it did not
